title: Associate Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at CARE (USA) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was about 3 months. It consisted of an HR screening where they provided the questions prior to the zoom call, interview with the department Director followed by a panel interview and finally with the Department head. They took quite a while to get back to me with the final decision and didn't communicate it would take that long to make their decision.
Interview Questions: What excites you about the role and organization?

title: Senior Communications Manager, Mega Gift Strategy and Content Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at CARE (USA) (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: 1st step: HR screening - video call 2nd step: Questionnaire 3rd step: Interview with the Hiring Manager, who would also be the supervisor of this position, the Executive Director of the department. 4th step: writing test 5th step: final interview I was not contacted by anyone to inform me that the position had been filled. After all of the work and preparation I put into this interview, I would have appreciated a follow-up email notifying me that they would not be moving forward with me. Such a lack of consideration has certainly left me with a bad impression of the organization.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for CARE? What do you know about the organization? Tell me about your background as it relates to this position.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at CARE (USA) (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
Process over the course of months, 1:1, panels, etc. fairly normal if long. 

“Strategy assignments” (plural!) with unrealistic timeframes to complete satisfactorily. Serious red flags on work life balance and culture. One is reasonable. Four is unacceptable.

In hindsight, less about skills or compatibility and more about fishing for ideas. 

Applicants, you are valuable and above free work.
Interview Questions: How did you learn about CARE? why does our work resonate?

title: Regional Business Analyst Interview

Interview Questions:
1. Pre-screening open ended questionnaire

4. Oral Interview

title: Program Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at CARE (USA) (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Communication was not optimal from organization. Applied online and completed a lengthy pre-screen assessment. Invited for an interview. Three weeks after the interview, completion of background check, and reference check I had still heard  nothing, so I contacted the HR representative. She replied to tell me that they had gone with another candidate.  I completely understand that they went with someone else based on qualifications, etc. However, I do feel that once someone has gotten to the interview/background check/reference check stage, at least a courtesy email is appreciated if that candidate isn't chosen. From application to final word from HR, the process took two months.
Interview Questions: What one word would your manager use to describe you? Your friends? Your coworkers?

Interview Questions: How would you approach a particular situation specialized to this position?

title: Administrative Support Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at CARE (USA) (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I read the job description completely.  I wrote a custom cover letter and resume matching my skills to the skills requested in the job description.  I got an email requesting that I complete a pre-screen questionnaire; which I did.  I was then contacted and scheduled a phone interview. I prepared for the phone interview; re-read the job description, had my copy of the cover letter, resume and pre-screen and waited for the call in an empty conference room (to minimize distractions).
The interview began with introductions of all the interviews and an outline of the interview process.  A few minutes into it, they made it clear they were looking for a "must have", very specific previous experience and skill.  This "must have" was no where on the job description, and a transferable, related skill (that I do have) was listed on the job description at the "15% of time" level of the job duty.
Since I did not have this particular specific former experience, the phone interview was terminated.
Interview Questions: How does this position complement your background and strengths? (From the pre-screen questionnaire; also noting that my answer would serve as my writing sample.)
